results.title: Hayburners
results.creator_credit: Tom Robertson and Multi Media Productions
results.brief_description: Young Will Bennett has been assigned a steer to raise and to groom for a 4H club contest, but he is sadly disappointed in the “Hayburner” he has ended up with. A middle-aged retarded helper named Joe enters the scene and sees promise in the animal. Together Will and Joe work to win with Mickey. Based on the novel by Gene Smith.

results.title: Have You Ever Thought?
results.creator_credit: Doreen Bentley and Christian Myles Productions
results.brief_description: A short documentary about the lives and the work of the Pastorelle Sisters, an order of Nuns in Thornbury, Melbourne. Their lives are centred around the person and teaching of Jesus, lived out in small communities, deeply concerned about the life of people, and working with clergy and laity in the building up of Christian communities.

results.title: Have a heart
results.creator_credit: Kaye Dyal, Ken Plotin, Saul Rubin and Tantalus Films
results.brief_description: Describes the function of the heart and circulatory system and emphasises the need for a healthy lifestyle to prevent heart disease. A heart attack victim is shown being given electric shock treatment. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Hardy Wilson: a living memory
results.brief_description: Hardy Wilson was an Australian architect and artist who acknowledged a climate that was non-European and designed houses and commercial buildings which were sympathetic to their surroundings. He was also a watercolourist, furniture designer, and a prolific social and philosophical writer. This film is of interest to an audience interested in Australian heritage and culture.

results.title: Happy to be me (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Arthur Mokin and Arthur Mokin Productions
results.brief_description: A documentary based on a survey of more than 600 students from kindergarten through high school, that provides an objective view of young people’s attitudes toward gender, or male and female roles. Candid interviews and spontaneous scenes of young people interacting at school, at play, and in the community, help create an awareness of one’s assumptions about maleness and femaleness.

results.title: Happy locomotive
results.creator_credit: Stephen Fitzgerald, Baltimore and Ohio Railroad Company and Unifilm
results.brief_description: An animated film describing the dangers which confront an engine driver. Many of the hazards are caused by unthinking people, children and vandals. Accidents could be avoided if the public remembered simple safety rules.

results.title: Hans Heysen recollections
results.creator_credit: Eugene Schlusser, Reg McLean and Lion's Den Productions
results.brief_description: A comprehensive and personal documentary about the life of one the most renowned painters of the Australian landscape, Hans Heysen. The program centers around interviews with his surviving children, including the Archibald Prize winning artist Nora Heysen, and focuses on the regions around Hahndorf, South Australia, and the Flinders Ranges where his painting was most prolific. It provides a reflective portrayal of his artistry, his concern for the Australian environment, his wide network of supporters and friends, and his influence on others intertwined with a sensitive study of his personal history.

results.title: Hannah and the dog ghost
results.brief_description: A folktale about Hannah, a young widow who lives with her son in Texas at the turn of the century. When her son is stolen by an evil fiddle man, Hannah rescues him after a series of adventures in which she is aided by a mysterious dog. Stars Vickie Washington.

results.title: Hamam: the Turkish bath
results.creator_credit: Ferzan Ozpetec, Marco Risi, Maurizio Tedesco and Sorpasso Film
results.brief_description: This Italian-Turkish co-production is the story of a successful Italian businessman, Francesco, who goes to Istanbul to settle the estate of his estranged Aunt. In Turkey he encounters his Aunt’s surrogate family and decides to stay on in Istanbul and restore an old hamam (Turkish bath). Francesco finds that not only is he attracted to the generosity of his new “family”, he also finds himself sexually attracted to the son, Mehmet. When his wife Marta arrives from Italy they find themselves locked in a bitter exchange that strips bare the lies and evasions that underpin their marriage. For both Marta and Francesco, the city of Istanbul - half European, half Asian - comes to symbolise a freedom, a romance and a community that is no longer available in the fast-paced materialistic culture of Western Europe. And for both of them, with the destruction of their marriage and the intervention of violent tragedy, they discover themselves recreating the Aunt’s original exile. Filmed in location in Istanbul, this is the first film of Turkish director Ferzan Ozpetac. Cast includes Allessandro Gassman and Francesca d’Aloja. In Italian and Turkish with English subtitles. (Awards: Winner of two Golden Globe Awards for Best First Film and for Best Musical Score)

results.title: Hail to the chef
results.brief_description: Master chefs from 21 nations compete for gold and silver medals in an eight day marathon focusing on culinary expertise. Each country prepares dishes which are associated with their own nationality.
